name: WPSSO Ridiculously Responsive Social Sharing Buttons (RRSSB)
author: JS Morisset

sections.description:
Ridiculously Responsive Social Sharing Buttons automatically resize to their container width, so they always look great on any device (phone, tablet, laptop, etc.), no matter its size or resolution – including mobile, Retina, and high-PPI displays!

WPSSO RRSSB Add-on Features

Include responsive social sharing buttons in many locations:

  • Above and/or below your content, excerpt text, WooCommerce short description, and WooCommerce add to cart.
  • In the admin editing page Document SSO metabox.
  • In a CSS / javascript sidebar.
  • In a WordPress sharing widget.
  • From a shortcode in your content or excerpt.
  • From a function in your theme’s template(s).

Provides UTM medium, UTM source, and UTM campaign values for each social sharing button.

A stylesheet editor allows you to easily fine-tune the CSS for each social sharing button location (content, excerpt, shortcode, widget, etc.).

Includes CSS and JS libraries provided by the RRSSB project on GitHub.

WPSSO Core Required

WPSSO Ridiculously Responsive Social Sharing Buttons (WPSSO RRSSB) is an add-on for the WPSSO Core plugin, which provides complete structured data for WordPress to present your content at its best for social sites and search results – no matter how URLs are shared, reshared, messaged, posted, embedded, or crawled.
sections.installation:
Install and Uninstall

  • Install the WPSSO RRSSB add-on.
  • Uninstall the WPSSO RRSSB add-on.
sections.faq:
Frequently Asked Questions
  • None.
Notes and Documentation
  • RRSSB Shortcode for Social Sharing Buttons
sections.changelog:
Version Numbering

Version components: {major}.{minor}.{bugfix}[-{stage}.{level}]

  • {major} = Major structural code changes and/or incompatible API changes (ie. breaking changes).
  • {minor} = New functionality was added or improved in a backwards-compatible manner.
  • {bugfix} = Backwards-compatible bug fixes or small improvements.
  • {stage}.{level} = Pre-production release: dev < a (alpha) < b (beta) < rc (release candidate).

Standard Edition Repositories

  • GitHub
  • WordPress.org

Development Version Updates

WPSSO Core Premium edition customers have access to development, alpha, beta, and release candidate version updates:

Under the SSO > Update Manager settings page, select the “Development and Up” (for example) version filter for the WPSSO Core plugin and/or its add-ons. When new development versions are available, they will automatically appear under your WordPress Dashboard > Updates page. You can reselect the “Stable / Production” version filter at any time to reinstall the latest stable version.

WPSSO Core Standard edition users (ie. the plugin hosted on WordPress.org) have access to the latest development version under the Advanced Options section.

Changelog / Release Notes

Version 11.3.0 (2024/02/21)

  • New Features
    • None.
  • Improvements
    • Renamed Twitter to X (Twitter).
    • Removed the Tumblr button.
  • Bugfixes
    • None.
  • Developer Notes
    • None.
  • Requires At Least
    • PHP v7.2.34.
    • WordPress v5.8.
    • WPSSO Core v17.14.0.

  • New Features
    • None.
  • Improvements
    • None.
  • Bugfixes
    • None.
  • Developer Notes
    • Added support for the new SucomUtilWP::doing_dev() method.
  • Requires At Least
    • PHP v7.2.34.
    • WordPress v5.8.
    • WPSSO Core v17.12.0.

Version 11.1.0 (2024/01/12)

  • New Features
    • None.
  • Improvements
    • None.
  • Bugfixes
    • None.
  • Developer Notes
    • Update for SucomUtil and SucomUtilWP changes in WPSSO Core v17.8.0.
  • Requires At Least
    • PHP v7.2.34.
    • WordPress v5.8.
    • WPSSO Core v17.8.0.

Version 11.0.0 (2023/11/08)

  • New Features
    • None.
  • Improvements
    • None.
  • Bugfixes
    • None.
  • Developer Notes
    • Refactored the settings page and metabox load process for WPSSO Core v17.0.0.
  • Requires At Least
    • PHP v7.2.34.
    • WordPress v5.8.
    • WPSSO Core v17.0.0.

1. WPSSO RRSSB example showing buttons enabled in the CSS sidebar, content text, and widget.

  2. WPSSO RRSSB example showing a WooCommerce product page with buttons in the CSS sidebar, short and long product descriptions.
sections.reviews:
Invasive Plugin

By Banjoo (ozarc) on December 10, 2023

Horrible plugin that invades pages its not supposed to. Have set this to ONLY be posts, yet its in every page of my website. It even inserts itself into the backend of every page, as if i want to now share my wordpress page's backend on social media. Why on earth would i ever want to do that!

Avoid and look elsewhere unless you enjoy your website being invaded form ever corner by a plugin.

Also, this requires another Schema plugin to work which in itself makes not sense.

All i wanted was a social share plugin for my posts, what i got instead was a plugin that inserts itself into ever corner of my front and backend, grouped with another schema plugin that i didn't want or need

good one

By theshiftindia on December 28, 2019

good one

What Are You Waiting For? Install

By sportsturf on December 13, 2019

Very easy to install. I, however, have not done one thing yet to customize but will get there. Here is a tip for older theme users. Some older themes provide social sharing buttons. Well, these stupid buttons are png's and embedded so you are not going to fix them. Install this plugin figure out how to deactivate the theme's social sharing options and do a GTMetrix before and after. Your waterfall will be so much more verticle than horizontal. If you don't know what I'm talking about, time to explore.

Must-have plugin and spotless support

By Richard Foley (richardfoley) on October 3, 2018

the WPSSO-RRSSB plugin is a must-have plugin. Works well and the support is tremendous. Even before I'd paid for the Pro upgrade, the developer was keenly assisting with a small issue I had where several (WPSSO and other) plugins were not working together as expected. All resolved. Much kudos for good work!

Works well

By vmajor on September 17, 2018

It seems to do what it says

Great useful plugin

By Lorenzo Bolognini (ldeleo) on December 14, 2017

Great plugin, does the job and never had a rendering issue.

Fast and sleek!

By renoduck on January 26, 2017

These buttons are the bees knees for real. They look great across all platforms, play nice with w3-total-cache and doesn't impact my 100/100 pagespeed score so the end user is happy too! And yes, the support is as good as it gets so feel good about buying the pro version

really good

By zenithude on January 14, 2017

i use free version , no problem all is good

FANTASTIC!

By mikegoubeaux on September 3, 2016

This plugin is one of my favorites! JS aggressively develops and improves this suite of plugins, continuously improving and adding features - with great customer support to boot! This plugin makes it SOOO simple to add social sharing (ridiculously responsive!) to wordpress posts!

Rediculously Amazing Support and Product

By annieandre on September 3, 2016

I have 2 plugins RRSSB and WPSSO and they both work beyond anything I ever expected. Especially when I compare them to other plugins I have used.

The support is lightening fast, and very easy to understand.

I wish I could give 10 stars *********
